channel.title: BBC News - Europe
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: EU chief rejects UK bid to renegotiate Brexit deal
item.description: Boris Johnson speaks to EU chief Ursula von der Leyen about the UK's demand to rework the Brexit deal.

item.title: Coronavirus: Italy brings in Covid certificate amid spike in infections
item.description: All those aged 12 and over with at least one jab will be able to access bars, cinemas and gyms.

item.title: Pegasus spyware: French President Macron changes phone after hack reports
item.description: Mr Macron was one of several world leaders reportedly targeted by NSO Group's Pegasus spyware.

item.title: Channel crossings: Hundreds more migrants cross to UK
item.description: The government said a surge in illegal migration across Europe had seen a rise in crossings.

item.title: Tokyo 2020 men's football: Richarlison inspires Brazil, Spain held by Egypt, Wood makes history for NZ
item.description: Richarlison's first-half hat-trick inspires Brazil to a 4-2 win over Germany despite a second-half wobble, as Spain are held by Egypt.

item.title: Nord Stream 2: US and Germany reach deal on controversial Russian gas pipeline
item.description: The US says the agreement prevents Russia from using the pipeline as a political weapon over Europe.

item.title: UK has no idea of EU fishing catch in its waters, says Labour
item.description: The government says it is trying to get EU boats to declare everything they land in UK waters.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics - what to look out for
item.description: With the opening ceremony set for Friday, BBC Sport previews the Tokyo 2020 Olympics - a Games like no other.

item.title: Soldier statue reignites Spanish row over fascism
item.description: Spain's legionnaires symbolised fascism, but Madrid may soon have a statue honouring them.

item.title: Benin Bronzes: Nigeria dispute jeopardises return of artefacts
item.description: Several museums in Europe have talked of returning the looted artefacts - but where will they be housed in Nigeria?

item.title: I survived Norway's worst terror attack
item.description: Lisa Husby recalls hiding in fear as far-right extremist Anders Breivik went on a killing spree in 2011.

item.title: A promise to his grandma & an unprecedented welcome - Lukas Podolski finally makes his dream move
item.description: Lukas Podolski is set for his competitive debut for boyhood club Gornik Zabrze and BBC Sport looks at how he is fulfilling a family promise.

item.title: In pictures: Germany grapples with flood aftermath
item.description: A massive clean-up is under way, but Germany's flood damage won't be fixed for many months.

item.title: Europe floods: 'I have an axe beside my bed'
item.description: Marion Wenzel showed the BBC around her flood-wrecked house in Ahrweiler, Germany.

item.title: First space tourist Dennis Tito: 'I was euphoric'
item.description: Dennis Tito paid $20 million to travel to the International Space Station in 2001.

item.title: Horse racing: Inside the abattoir slaughtering racehorses
item.description: Campaign group Animal Aid set up covert cameras in one of the few slaughterhouses licensed to kill horses.

item.title: Europe floods: Residents return home to see damage inflicted
item.description: Resident in Kleivelderweg, deep inside the Dutch disaster zone, find homes and businesses destroyed.

item.title: Drone footage shows flood damage in Germany and Belgium
item.description: At least 120 people have died and hundreds more are unaccounted for in western Europe.
